metadata.synopsis: Halsin at the Epilogue party. Speaking out loud to himself/no one in particular.

0.speaker: Halsin
0.text: I must be careful to not overindulge tonight, lest I lose control and slip into bear form...
0.context: NodeContext: Semi-serious. Halsin at the Epilogue party. Speaking out loud to himself/no one in particular.

1.speaker: Halsin
1.text: Perhaps the bard knows some of my favourites - unless my taste in music is too antique of course.
1.context: NodeContext: Hopeful. Halsin at the Epilogue party. Speaking out loud to himself/no one in particular.

3.speaker: Halsin
3.text: Reunited with friends, amidst nature. What more could I wish for?
3.context: NodeContext: Content. Halsin at the Epilogue party. Speaking out loud to himself/no one in particular.

4.speaker: Halsin
4.text: I cannot remember the last time I heard the 'The Ballad of the Endless Spring' performed - now there's a ditty worthy of a knee-slap.
4.context: NodeContext: Dreaming of the 350 year-old druid equivalent of dad rock.  Halsin at the Epilogue party. Speaking out loud to himself/no one in particular.

6.speaker: Halsin
6.text: Withers has laid out quite a spread of food, for one comprising mostly of bone.
6.context: NodeContext: Impressed. Halsin at the Epilogue party. Speaking out loud to himself/no one in particular.

2.speaker: Halsin
2.text: Perhaps he wishes to live vicariously through the attendees' appetites.
